abstract: An object that represents the arrangement of seats, equipment, and counters around the game table.

codeExamples.code:
setup.add(seat: Seat(index: 0, position: .init(x: 0, z: -0.5)))
setup.add(seat: Seat(index: 1, position: .init(x: 0, z: +0.5)))

setup.add(equipment: Piece(position: .init(x: 0, z: 0.1)))
setup.add(equipment: Card(index: 0, faceUp: true, position: .init(x: -0.1, z: 0)))
setup.add(equipment: Card(index: 1, faceUp: true, position: .init(x: +0.1, z: 0)))
setup.add(equipment: Die(index: 0, position: .init(x: 0, z: 0.2)))

overview:
## Overview

To create a `TableSetup` object, pass an object that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Tabletop] or [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EntityTabletop] protocol to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/init(tabletop:)-4cfut] initializer. For example, implement a `Table` structure that conforms to the `EntityTabletop` protocol and pass an instance of it to the initializer.

Set the protocol properties, such as `shape`, `entity`, and `id` properties for the `EntityTabletop` protocol, in the initializer.

Then add seats, equipment, and counters to the `TableSetup` object.

To represent seats, create structures that conform to a seat protocol. To render seats using RealityKit, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EntityTableSeat] protocol and use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(seat:)-4alrc] or a similar method to add seats. Otherwise, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSeat] protocol and use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(seat:)-a9qw] or a similar method to add seats.

To represent equipment, create structures that conform to an equipment protocol. To render equipment using RealityKit, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EntityEquipment] protocol and use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(equipment:)-24tv6] or a similar method to add equipment. Otherwise, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Equipment] protocol and use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(equipment:)-29pef] or a similar method to add equipment.

Some equipment can represent a group, such as a player’s hand in a card game. To organize equipment hierarchically, set the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EquipmentState/parentID] property of the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Equipment/State] property during gameplay. In your equipment structure implementation, you can override the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Equipment/layoutChildren(for:visualState:)] method to lay out the containing equipment.

Optionally, add one or more [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/ScoreCounter] objects to the `TableSetup` object to keep score of the game. Use either the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(counter:)] or [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(counters:)] method to add score counters.

Finally, create the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame] instance from the `TableSetup` object by passing it to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/init(tableSetup:version:)] initializer.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup
crawled: 2025-12-02T16:04:15Z

# TableSetup

**Structure**

An object that represents the arrangement of seats, equipment, and counters around the game table.

## Declaration

```swift
struct TableSetup
```

## Overview

To create a `TableSetup` object, pass an object that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Tabletop] or [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EntityTabletop] protocol to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/init(tabletop:)-4cfut] initializer. For example, implement a `Table` structure that conforms to the `EntityTabletop` protocol and pass an instance of it to the initializer.

```swift
let table = Table()
root = createRootEntity(table: table.entity)
var setup = TableSetup(tabletop: table)
```

Set the protocol properties, such as `shape`, `entity`, and `id` properties for the `EntityTabletop` protocol, in the initializer.

```swift
struct Table: EntityTabletop {
    var shape: TabletopShape
    var entity: Entity
    var id: EquipmentIdentifier
    
    init() {
        self.entity = try! Entity.load(named: "table/table", in: contentBundle)
        self.shape = .round(entity: entity)
        self.id = .table
    }
}
```

Then add seats, equipment, and counters to the `TableSetup` object.

To represent seats, create structures that conform to a seat protocol. To render seats using RealityKit, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EntityTableSeat] protocol and use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(seat:)-4alrc] or a similar method to add seats. Otherwise, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSeat] protocol and use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(seat:)-a9qw] or a similar method to add seats.

```swift
setup.add(seat: Seat(index: 0, position: .init(x: 0, z: -0.5)))
setup.add(seat: Seat(index: 1, position: .init(x: 0, z: +0.5)))
```

To represent equipment, create structures that conform to an equipment protocol. To render equipment using RealityKit, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EntityEquipment] protocol and use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(equipment:)-24tv6] or a similar method to add equipment. Otherwise, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Equipment] protocol and use the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(equipment:)-29pef] or a similar method to add equipment.

```swift
setup.add(equipment: Piece(position: .init(x: 0, z: 0.1)))
setup.add(equipment: Card(index: 0, faceUp: true, position: .init(x: -0.1, z: 0)))
setup.add(equipment: Card(index: 1, faceUp: true, position: .init(x: +0.1, z: 0)))
setup.add(equipment: Die(index: 0, position: .init(x: 0, z: 0.2)))
```

Some equipment can represent a group, such as a player’s hand in a card game. To organize equipment hierarchically, set the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EquipmentState/parentID] property of the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Equipment/State] property during gameplay. In your equipment structure implementation, you can override the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Equipment/layoutChildren(for:visualState:)] method to lay out the containing equipment.

Optionally, add one or more [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/ScoreCounter] objects to the `TableSetup` object to keep score of the game. Use either the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(counter:)] or [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup/add(counters:)] method to add score counters.

Finally, create the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame] instance from the `TableSetup` object by passing it to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/init(tableSetup:version:)] initializer.

```swift
game = TabletopGame(tableSetup: setup)
```

## Creating a setup object from a table

- **init(tabletop:)**
- **init(tabletop:)**

## Adding seats to place players

- **add(seat:)**: Add the given seat to the table setup.
- **add(seat:)**
- **add(seats:)**: Add the given seats to the table setup.
- **add(seats:)**

## Adding equipment for gameplay

- **add(equipment:)**: Add the given equipment to the table setup.
- **add(equipment:)**
- **add(equipment:)**
- **add(equipment:)**: Add the given equipment to the table setup.
- **add(equipment:)**: Add the given equipment to the table setup.
- **add(equipment:)**
- **add(equipment:)**
- **add(equipment:)**: Add the given equipment to the table setup.

## Adding counters to keep score

- **add(counter:)**
- **add(counters:)**

## Registering an action

- **register(action:)**: Register a custom action of given type. Each type of custom action needs to be registered before it can be used.

## Essentials

- **Creating tabletop games**: Develop a spatial board game where multiple players interact with pieces on a table.
- **Synchronizing group gameplay with TabletopKit**: Maintain game state across multiple players in a race to capture all the coins.
- **TabletopGame**: An object that manages the setup and gameplay of a tabletop game.
- **Tabletop**: A protocol for the table surface in your game.
- **EntityTabletop**: A protocol for the table surface in your game when you render it using RealityKit.
- **TabletopShape**: An object that represents the physical properties of the table.
